page.title: 05FLORA AND BIRDS
page.content: {FLORA, BIRDS NEAR DUNSMORE Apart from the more common birds such as the Tit family, Green and Lesser Spotted Wood Peckers, Owls and other passerines, the Meadow Pipit, Redstart and Wood Warbler all breed in this area. Some less usual flowers which can be seen on the higher land are Giant Bellflower, Felwort, Broad, leaved Helleborine, Common Spotted Orchid, Pyramidal Orchid and Gentiana Ciliata; a rare, tiny, blue_fringed flower, first recorded c.1850. Blackberries abound in the hedgerows and on the open hilltop where also is found a delicately flavoured wild Raspberry. The hedgerows bordering the old, sunken lanes are high and mixed with Hazel, Bramble, Hawthorn, Briar and Elder. Holly and Beech trees sometimes protrude from them, higher than the line of the hedge.
